column.name: TRANCODE
column.comment: Indicator for a record type for delta tables, N => New, M => Modify, D => Delete

column.name: DWH_SOURCE_IND
column.comment: Indicator from which system the data record comes (2: Debit, 3: Credit).

column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers who have a partner company) are), XMK ​​(Cross Market).

column.name: BAN
column.comment: Indication of the customer's billing account number. The customer is the (natural or legal) person to whom services are provided on the basis of a contract concluded with D2-Vodafone. The customer is responsible for payment for the services used by himself or by other participants belonging to him. If the customer account is assigned to a higher-level account (consolidated account), the higher-level account can also be responsible for payment.

column.name: SUBSCRIBER_NO
column.comment: Telephone Number

column.name: SOC
column.comment: Service order code, which is used to calculate the amount belonging to the characteristic.

column.name: SOC_SEQ_NO
column.comment: Sequence number of each assignment from SOC to participants in SERVICE_AGREEMENT This attribute is required to uniquely identify the associated SOC in the service agreement. It can happen that a participant can have two data records for a SOC with the same effective date if the agreement was concluded and reopened on the same day.

column.name: SOC_VER_NO
column.comment: This attribute displays the version number of the SOC.  This attribute is populated when the row is created.  The current version is always 0, the previous version is numbered 1, 2, 3 etc.

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: TARIFF_OPTION
column.comment: TARIFF_OPTION in KIAS2000

column.name: COMMIT_ORIG_NO_MONTH
column.comment: Specifies the commitment period in months.

column.name: SOC_EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: Date on which the SOC became active for the participant

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: effective change date

column.name: SERVICE_TYPE
column.comment: Typing of the service according to price plan, SOC, promotional SOC etc. Valid values ​​are: P - Price Plan, M - Reduced Price Plan, R - Regular SOC, S - Reduced SOC, O - Optional SOC, B - Buy-One-Get -One SOC, T - Toll RS, L - Toll SOC for RC.

column.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
column.comment: Expiry Date

column.name: SOC_LEVEL_CODE
column.comment: indicator is defined above the SOC at account or participant level. C - subscriber level B - BAN level

column.name: DEALER_CODE
column.comment: Code of Dealer

column.name: SALES_AGENT
column.comment: The sales agent involved in the sale to the customer (second dealer).

column.name: EFFECTIVE_ISSUE_DATE
column.comment: Contains the logical date on which the Service Agreement is issued. In the case of future or back dating, this field contains the date on which the change is requested.

column.name: EXPR_ISSUE_DATE
column.comment: Contains the logical date on which the Service Agreement expires. In the case of future or back dating, this field contains the date on which the change is requested.

column.name: TRX_ID
column.comment: This attribute links all lines updated in the same transaction. The attribute has technical uses for online proration. Updated when a row is created.

column.name: INS_TRX_ID
column.comment: Holds the Transaction ID in which the agreement is created. The attribute has technical uses for the CSM Transaction Process. This attribute is never changed.

column.name: CONV_RUN_NO
column.comment: Used for conversion.

column.name: CAMPAIGN_ID
column.comment: Campaign code from Affinitium Campaign (CAMPCODE) - Campaign, which has added the SOC

column.name: PRV_SOC
column.comment: The previous SOC if a replace SOC activity was performed.

column.name: NEXT_SOC
column.comment: The next SOC if a replace SOC activity was performed.
